solution_line_template: If Maude's age is {maude_age} by the time Anne's age is four times Emile's age, Emile will be six times as old as Maude, which totals {emile_multiplier}*{maude_age} = {emile_age} years.
If Emile's age is {emile_age} years old by the time Anne's age is twice her number, Anne will be {anne_multiplier}*{emile_age} = <<{emile_age}*{anne_multiplier}={anne_age}>>{anne_age} years.
